intro: Lotononis holosericea, commonly known as the silky lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, silky hairs that cover its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
